/_openapi.description: Endpoint for the OpenAPI specification for charted-server

get.description: Gets the document in JSON format or YAML format

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format to use

parameters.name: pretty
parameters.description: If the document should be pretty or not, this is only applicable to the JSON format

put.description: REST controller to create a new user into this instance. This can fail if the server is invite-only or if registrations are disabled.

requestBody.description: Payload object to create this user

400.description: If the session manager configured for this server is local, then this will indicate a password was not available

403.description: If the server doesn't allow new users to be created

delete.description: Deletes the current authenticated user. This will destroy all metadata (repositories, organizations), search indexing (if enabled), and all Helm charts that are published.

202.description: Session token was deleted from the server, and can't be validated again

401.description: If the session token couldn't be authorized successfully

403.description: Whether if the `Authorization` header is not present or the body was not a proper session token

406.description: Whether if the `Authorization` header was not in an acceptable format

get.description: Retrieve a single repository release resource

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Repository ID to lookup

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Valid SemVer version to lookup the release for

401.description: If the authentication handler couldn't authorize successfully

403.description: Whether if the `Authorization` header is not present or a REST controller requires the authentication type to be from a Session Token

404.description: If a session couldn't be found based off the authentication details given, or if a user wasn't found (can happen if a user was deleted)

406.description: Whether if the `Authorization` header is not in an acceptable format

errors.message: Version provided 'v1.noel-is-cute' was not a valid SemVer value

/users/@me/avatars.description: Upload a new avatar for the current authenticated user

post.description: Upload a new avatar, this can be in a `multipart/form-data` content-type, or in a `text/plain` type with the image being base64 encoded

requestBody.description: A multipart form-data of the image itself; if multiple parts were appended to this request, then all subsequent parts except the first one will be used. If this is a 'text/plain' request, then the server will only accept 'data:image/png;base64,<...>' as the body

202.description: Avatar was successfully updated, this will return an empty response

400.description: If the request was a multipart form-data, this will indicate that the selected part was not a File type

401.description: If the session token couldn't be authorized successfully

403.description: Whether if the `Authorization` header is not present or the body was not a proper session token

406.description:
This can indicate two types of problems:
* If it failed at the authentication level, it is indicated that the `Authorization` header was not in a valid format the server can accept,
* This can also indicate that the request body was not formatted in the way it can be accepted; it has to be in the form of 'data:image/{format};base64,...'

code.description: Kind of error that occurred. You can look up all the codes in the API documentation: https://charts.noelware.org/docs/server/api/reference#error-codes

message.description: More meaningful, humane response on why this request failed.

detail.description: Extra context about the error that might help prevent it in the future

ApiError.description:
Represents a structured object that can be serialized as an API response error for anyreason that might've occurred in a REST controller. It contains a `code` property, to identifythe error kind that this error is, a `message` property to give a more humane response on whyit failed, and optionally a `detail` property that gives more context on how this error came through.
You can read up all the codes present in the API documentation: https://charts.noelware.org/docs/server/current/api/reference#error-codes

description.description: Short descriptive text about this API key

expires_in.description: Datetime of when this API key has expired, `null` is represented as this API key will never expire

scopes.description: Bitfield of the available scopes for this API key, useful to restrict access to charted-server APIs that this key doesn't need

token.description: The token itself, this isn't revealed if you fetched it from the API, this is only populated when you create the key.

ApiKeys.description: Resource for a personal API key that is created by a user. This is useful for command line tools or scripts, but its main use-case is for the Helm plugin to help you push Helm charts easily into charted-server.

success.description: Indicator to whenever this request succeeded or not.
Indicator to whenever this request succeeded or not.

condition.description: YAML path that resolves to a Boolean, used for enabling/disabling charts.

tags.description: Tags can be used to group charts for enabling/disabling together

items.description: Tags can be used to group charts for enabling/disabling together

import-values.description: ImportValues holds the mapping of source values to parent key to be imported. Each item can be a string or pair of child/parent sublist items.

alias.description: Alias to be used for the chart. Useful when you have to add the same chart multiple times

ChartDependency.description: In Helm, one chart may depend on any number of other charts. These dependencies can be dynamically linked using the dependencies' field in Chart.yaml or brought in to the charts/ directory and managed manually. The charts required by the current chart are defined as a list in the dependencies field.

apiVersion.description: The apiVersion field should be v2 for Helm charts that require at least Helm 3. Charts supporting previous Helm versions have an apiVersion set to v1 and are still installable by Helm 3.

description.description: A single-sentence description of this project

keywords.description: List of keywords about this project. These keywords can be searched via the Repository Search API if a search backend is enabled.

items.description: List of keywords about this project. These keywords can be searched via the Repository Search API if a search backend is enabled.

home.description: The URL of this project's homepage.

sources.description: A list of URLs to the source code for this project

items.description: A list of URLs to the source code for this project

dependencies.description: In Helm, one chart may depend on any number of other charts. These dependencies can be dynamically linked using the dependencies' field in Chart.yaml or brought in to the charts/ directory and managed manually. The charts required by the current chart are defined as a list in the dependencies field.

maintainers.description: A list of name and URL/email address combinations for the maintainer(s)

icon.description: A URL or an SVG or PNG image to be used as an icon

appVersion.description:
Note that the appVersion field is not related to the version field. It is a way of specifying the version of theapplication. For example, the drupal chart may have an appVersion: "8.2.1", indicating that the version of Drupalincluded in the chart (by default) is 8.2.1. This field is informational, and has no impact on chart version calculations.
Wrapping the version in quotes is highly recommended. It forces the YAML parser to treat the version number as a string.Leaving it unquoted can lead to parsing issues in some cases. For example, YAML interprets 1.0 as a floating point value,and a git commit SHA like 1234e10 as scientific notation.

deprecated.description:
When managing charts in a Chart Repository, it is sometimes necessary to deprecate a chart. The optional deprecated fieldin Chart.yaml can be used to mark a chart as deprecated. If the latest version of a chart in the repository is markedas deprecated, then the chart as a whole is considered to be deprecated.
The chart name can be later reused by publishing a newer version that is not marked as deprecated.

additionalProperties.description: A list of annotations keyed by name and value.

annotations.description: A list of annotations keyed by name and value.

ChartIndexYaml.description: The index file in a chart repository

ChartMaintainer.description: Name and URL/email address combination as a maintainer. The `name` can be a [NameOrSnowflake] to reference a maintainer in the Hoshi UI.

apiVersion.description: The apiVersion field should be v2 for Helm charts that require at least Helm 3. Charts supporting previous Helm versions have an apiVersion set to v1 and are still installable by Helm 3.

description.description: A single-sentence description of this project

keywords.description: List of keywords about this project. These keywords can be searched via the Repository Search API if a search backend is enabled.

items.description: List of keywords about this project. These keywords can be searched via the Repository Search API if a search backend is enabled.

home.description: The URL of this project's homepage.

sources.description: A list of URLs to the source code for this project

items.description: A list of URLs to the source code for this project

dependencies.description: In Helm, one chart may depend on any number of other charts. These dependencies can be dynamically linked using the dependencies' field in Chart.yaml or brought in to the charts/ directory and managed manually. The charts required by the current chart are defined as a list in the dependencies field.

maintainers.description: A list of name and URL/email address combinations for the maintainer(s)

icon.description: A URL or an SVG or PNG image to be used as an icon

appVersion.description:
Note that the appVersion field is not related to the version field. It is a way of specifying the version of theapplication. For example, the drupal chart may have an appVersion: "8.2.1", indicating that the version of Drupalincluded in the chart (by default) is 8.2.1. This field is informational, and has no impact on chart version calculations.
Wrapping the version in quotes is highly recommended. It forces the YAML parser to treat the version number as a string.Leaving it unquoted can lead to parsing issues in some cases. For example, YAML interprets 1.0 as a floating point value,and a git commit SHA like 1234e10 as scientific notation.

deprecated.description:
When managing charts in a Chart Repository, it is sometimes necessary to deprecate a chart. The optional deprecated fieldin Chart.yaml can be used to mark a chart as deprecated. If the latest version of a chart in the repository is markedas deprecated, then the chart as a whole is considered to be deprecated.
The chart name can be later reused by publishing a newer version that is not marked as deprecated.

additionalProperties.description: A list of annotations keyed by name and value.

CreateApiKeyPayload.description: Represents a resource for creating API keys

password.description: Password for logging in, if the server is configured to use the local session manager, this is a required field.

email.description: Email address to identify this user

CreateUserPayload.description: Payload object to create a new User resource

Err.description: Represents an unsuccessful response, with any errors that might've occurred during the invocation of the request

errors.description: List of [ApiError] objects that might've occurred when invoking an request.

docker_registry.description: Whether if the external OCI registry experimental feature or the home-made implementation registry feature is enabled or not.

registrations.description: Whether if registrations are enabled on the server

audit_logs.description: Whether if the Audit Logging feature is enabled or not.

webhooks.description: Whether if the Webhooks feature is enabled or not.

is_invite_only.description: Whether if this server instance is invite-only.

additionalProperties.description: Mapping of all available session integrations.

integrations.description: Mapping of all available session integrations.

search.description: Whether if the server has search capabilities with the Elasticsearch or Meilisearch backend

FeaturesResponse.description: Data that is sent out to the recipient, this can be any unstructured object that is returned from the API, or `null` if none is present.

distribution.description: The distribution the server is running off from

commit_sha.description: The commit hash from the Git repository.

version.description: Valid SemVer 2 of the current version of this instance

vendor.description: Vendor of charted-server, will always be "Noelware"

InfoResponse.description: Represents the response for the `GET /info` REST handler.

MainRepositoryResponse.description: Data that is sent out to the recipient, this can be any unstructured object that is returned from the API, or `null` if none is present.

message.description: Message to greet users! Will always be "Hello, world! ðŸ‘‹"

tagline.description: Tagline of charted-server, will always be "You know, for Helm charts?"

MainResponse.description: Represents the response for the `GET /` method.

message.description: Generic message to greet the user to the Users API!

docs_url.description: Documentation URL for the Users API

MainUserResponse.description: Generic entrypoint response for the Users API

Name.description: Valid UTF-8 string that is used to point to a user, repository, or organization resource. Mainly used for `idOrName` path parameters in REST controllers to help identify which resource to locate from a valid `Snowflake` identifier, or a Name to point to a resource.

NameOrSnowflake.description: Union discriminated type that can resolve a valid `Snowflake`, or a `Name` that can safely point to a user, organization, or repository

Ok.description: Represents a successful response, with any data attached if any

data.description: Data that is sent out to the recipient, this can be any unstructured object that is returned from the API, or `null` if none is present.

success.description: Indicator to whenever this request succeeded or not.

verified_publisher.description: Whether if this organization is a verified publisher on this instance

twitter_handle.description: Twitter handle for this organization that will probably lead to a valid Twitter account.

gravatar_email.description: Valid email address that points to a Gravatar avatar, or `null` if it shouldn't use one as the primary avatar

display_name.description: Display name for this organization. It should be formatted as '{display_name} (@{name})'or just '{name}' in applications that use the API and the default formatting that Hoshi uses

created_at.description: Date of when this organization was registered to this instance

updated_at.description: Date of when the server has last updated this organization

icon_hash.description: Unique hash to locate an organization's icon, this also includes the extension that this icon is, i.e, `png`.

private.description: Whether this organization is private and only its member can access this resource.

Organization.description: Represents a unified organization that can own and manage repositories. An "organization" in the API server is used as a business that houses multiple Helm projects.

PatchApiKeyPayload.description: Represents a resource for patching API key metadata

description.description: Short description about this user, can be `null` if none was provided.

deprecated.description: Whether if this repository is or not

created_at.description: Date of when this repository was registered to this instance

updated_at.description: Date of when the server has last updated this repository

icon_hash.description: Unique hash to locate a repository's icon, this also includes the extension that this avatar is, i.e, `png`.

private.description: Whether if this repository is private or not

type.description: The chart type that this repository is

update_text.description: Markdown-formatted string that contains a changelog of this release.

created_at.description: Date-time of when this repository release resource was created at.

updated_at.description: Date-time of when this repository release was last updated at.

RepositoryRelease.description:
Represents a Repository Release resource. Releases are a way to group Helm chart versions as a singular tag that can be fetched from the API server.
Any repository can have an unlimited amount of tags, but tags cannot clash into each other, so there is no more than release tag per release. Each tag has to be a SemVer 2 comformant string and is validated by the API server.

Session.description: Represents a session token object. This is how sessions are stored when authenticating to charted-server.

Snowflake.description: A unique identifier that points to a User, Repository, or Organization resource

StringOrImportValue.description: ImportValues holds the mapping of source values to parent key to be imported. Each item can be a string or pair of child/parent sublist items.

Unit.description: Data that is sent out to the recipient, this can be any unstructured object that is returned from the API, or `null` if none is present.

verified_publisher.description: Whether if this User is a Verified Publisher or not.

gravatar_email.description: Valid email address that points to a Gravatar avatar, or `null` if it shouldn't use one as the primary avatar

description.description: Short description about this user, can be `null` if none was provided.

avatar_hash.description: Unique hash to locate a user's avatar, this also includes the extension that this avatar is, i.e, `png`.

created_at.description: Date of when this user was registered to this instance

updated_at.description: Date of when the server has last updated this user

admin.description: Whether if this User is an Administrator of this instance

name.description: Display name for this user, it should be displayed as '{name} (@{username})' or just '@{username}' if there is no display name

User.description: Represents an account that can own repositories and organizations

username.description: Username to authenticate as. This is mutually exclusive with `email`.

password.description: Raw password to authenticate the user as.

email.description: Email to authenticate a user as, this is mutually exclusive with `username`.

SessionToken.description: Session token from the POST /users/login endpoint
